channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Mixed as Bank Earnings Kick Off
item.description: U.S. stocks were mixed as bank earnings kicked off. The S&P 500 and Dow industrials rose, while the Nasdaq Composite edged down.

item.title: JPMorgan Chase tops estimates for profit and revenue on better-than-expected interest income
item.description: JPMorgan said profit fell 2% from a year earlier to $12.9 billion, while revenue climbed 6% to $43.32 billion.

item.title: Accelerated Pace of ECB Rate Cuts Could Weaken Euro
item.description: Risks are skewed to a faster pace of interest-rate cuts by the ECB than previously envisaged, which could weigh on the euro, Brown Brothers Harriman s...

item.title: 7-Eleven's parent company cuts full-year earnings forecast, presses ahead with restructuring
item.description: The news comes as the Japanese retail group resists a takeover attempt by Canada's Alimentation Couche-Tard.

item.title: Delta sales guidance disappoints, CEO says airline expects lower demand around the election
item.description: Delta Air Lines expects to grow earnings in the fourth quarter, thanks to resilient travel demand and strong bookings for year-end holidays.

item.title: The Fed is finally cutting rates, but banks aren't in the clear just yet
item.description: When the Federal Reserve cut its benchmark rate by half a percentage point last month, it boosted prospects for many banks.

item.title: JPMorgan Calls It: The U.S. Economy Has Made a Soft Landing
item.description: The bank reported better-than-expected third-quarter results, a sign that the economy is chugging along as the Fed lowers interest rates.

item.title: Treasury Yields Lose Steam After Unchanged PPI
item.description: Treasury yields lost steam, falling after unchanged PPI.

item.title: Wells Fargo shares jump after earnings top Wall Street expectations
item.description: The San Francisco-based lender posted $11.69 billion in net interest income, a 11% decrease from the same quarter last year.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Gains on Heating Demand Expectations
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures were higher as weather forecasts added expectations of increased demand.
